sentence.text: They delight to lead human beings astray ( Matthew 24:24 ; John 8:44 ) .
It would have been a richer joy -- but , indeed , as I so often tell you , I delight to picture you in a childlike serenity .
Surely there could n't be other women who delighted in such anguish .
But Mary was delighting quietly in the atmosphere of freedom .
Feminists ca n't blame it all on men -- since time began , men have delighted in our wobbly bits , thank heaven .
The book delights in combat , squirming with pleasure and letting out little gasps and moans of delight as adrenalin races through the character 's body .
Pynchon , like Joyce , delights in repeating details in new contexts so as to tantalize the reader into thinking he/she has missed crucial meanings .
It was Francis with his head back laughing , inhaling all the joy of the world ; Francis delighting in the flowers he threw together with branches and invited me to enjoy .
We learn to delight in God alone .
The Queen delighted in his preaching and made him Dean of Westminster .
The girls groaned over this , except the quick ones like Irene who delighted in it , but it meant that there was no need for anyone to open the desk because it was all oral work .
This is impossible without the Trinity , in which each person of the Godhead delights in the others .
She delights in Strauss and Mozart ` because the women in their operas are contradictory ; warm and cool at the same time " .
The media has delighted in telling tales of people who bought a picture then watched as their house burnt down or their car blew up .
She soaped all of him , delighting in his textures and curves , delighting in what her touch did to his body .
The modern hero delights too much in his wardrobe .
Here you will delight at the colourful stalls , the friendly bantering and the mouthwatering produce .
Mr Depardieu also delights in adding lurid colour to his teenage days on the streets of Chteauroux .
Mr Gillis seemed to delight in slamming it down on the top of the tousled head below .
The heir to the throne , a shy , sensitive boy , was often held upside down over the lavatory by schoolmates who delighted in pulling the chain .
You should have been a guerrilla leader , Sara , you delight in winning small skirmishes . "
The man is a huge liability and seems to delight in putting his feet right in it .
To Hugh she seemed beautiful and he delighted , somewhat guiltily , in having her eat opposite him .
` I would scorn to display such hypocrisy as you delight in , " retorted Miss Merchiston .
